storyInfo: The Witch King builds his 'Palace' in the Kargereich. Ebenholz and the old Lich Fremont meet the Witch King at different times.

attributes.content: Herr Giallo? Frau Droste?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Ebenholz is uncertain when he got separated from the others. Crumbling structures fall periodically from above, and the stairs beneath his feet spiral endlessly.
He can only move forward. He is alone, indefatigable.
You are despicable, Ebenholz.
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'?

attributes.content: You've interfered in our judgment, wasted our time, and hindered our cause. You're practically the worst sinner there is!
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'?

attributes.content: Forgive me if I don't look as sorry as I feel.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: So would you join us for an audience with His Majesty now? Or would you seek to prevent his return to the mundane world?
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'?

attributes.content: You do not have what it takes, you could not do it.
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'?

attributes.content: That should have been clear long ago. We should have known.
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'?

attributes.content: It's obvious. His Majesty's blood is so strong, his soul so tenacious. The Voice of Mundane was but a byproduct of his music, and yet it alone had brought you to your knees with the pain it inflicts.
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'?

attributes.content: You were born weak, far too weak to live up to any expectations.
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'?

attributes.content: That is to say, you're the ones forcing those wretched noises into my mind?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Then, in the end, is it me who bears responsibility for all of this?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Hmph, you should be thankful, Ebenholz.
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'?

attributes.content: Should they'd known from the beginning that the Voice of Mundane wasn't the key to His Majesty's inheritance, would the Twins have granted you the title of Graf Urtica?
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'?

attributes.content: No, even before then, you'd have died in the cradle.
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'?

attributes.content: You should take pride in your title, but more than that, you should be ashamed of it!
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'?

attributes.content: Ja, I feel the same.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: And so, begone!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You are hateful, Ebenholz.
attributes.name: Enraged Passerby?

attributes.content: How many died under the Witch King's tyranny? How many disappeared without a trace? Leithanien is scarred, and even twenty-three years later, the wounds are still bleeding.
attributes.name: Enraged Passerby?

attributes.content: Verdammt! Only for the tyrant to die silently one night, never knowing any proper justice!
attributes.name: Enraged Passerby?

attributes.content: And you, his last remaining descendant! You were born with the mark of sin in your blood. You should atone for him! Atone for all he did to Leithanien!
attributes.name: Enraged Passerby?

attributes.content: What right do you have to live a comfortable life, Ebenholz, all while mocking yourself as an 'obvious nobody'?
attributes.name: Enraged Passerby?

attributes.content: I despise this sin-tainted blood each and every day, the same as you do!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: No, you have no idea the evil it has wrought. Those remnants steal into Urtica again and again, encircling your spire like flies to rotting meat.
attributes.name: Urtican Subject?

attributes.content: My youngest son had only just joined the security forces when he found their trail. His corpse bobbed in a ravine for three days before they found it. All while you hid away in your spire!
attributes.name: Urtican Subject?

attributes.content: Do you even know the size of the Urtica domain? What crops it produces, how often the tax collector comes from the capital, what disasters the land has suffered in recent years?
attributes.name: Urtican Subject?

attributes.content: There is no Lehnsherr more hateful than you, Your Illustrious Highness.
attributes.name: Urtican Subject?

attributes.content: Stop, go no further. The braver you are, the more ridiculous you look.
attributes.name: Biegler?

attributes.content: You are pitiful, Ebenholz.
attributes.name: Biegler?

attributes.content: Do you remember Gertrude? Before she died, she left some real nasty curses. She cursed Vyseheim, Leithanien, the Witch King... and she cursed you.
attributes.name: Biegler?

attributes.content: Her curse was, word for word: 'May the madness of Ebenholz's bloodline haunt him forever.'
attributes.name: Biegler?

attributes.content: When you came back to Zwillingstürme, I thought to myself, damn, that madwoman's curse really came to pass. That stubborn kid couldn't escape the vortex of fate.
attributes.name: Biegler?

attributes.content: Of course he would never give in to fate, but this time, he'll have to fall into madness to break free of it.
attributes.name: Biegler?

attributes.content: You should feel relieved... shouldn't you?
attributes.name: Biegler?

attributes.content: The Voice of Mundane has troubled you for over a decade. But even more than resisting it, you've been carefully guarding it.
attributes.name: Biegler?

attributes.content: You were guarding a bomb, afraid that it would blow at any moment. Afraid that the wrong people could use it to hurt the innocent.
attributes.name: Biegler?

attributes.content: That was a heavy burden, an extraordinary... fate.
attributes.name: Biegler?

attributes.content: But in the end, it was just noise. A totally nonlethal headache... Go home, Ebenholz. Gertrude's curse has already fizzled.
attributes.name: Biegler?

attributes.content: Nein!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I can't bear it!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Because this is an even more debilitating curse?
attributes.name: Biegler?

attributes.content: In the end, your struggle isn't even worth mentioning, your resistance is meaningless. Those who sacrificed themselves for this, those tears and smiles you've carried in your mind forever...
attributes.name: Biegler?

attributes.content: How will you face them?
attributes.name: Biegler?

attributes.content: You've come to realize that trust, pity, understanding, mutual reliance... All those incredibly beautiful emotions, they're not precious because they're rare.
attributes.name: Biegler?

attributes.content: But they can suddenly turn so light, so weightless...
attributes.name: Biegler?

attributes.content: Like a joke.
attributes.name: Biegler?

attributes.text: How could they be a joke?!

attributes.content: He looks to the spire.
Hah, I knew it. I knew you'd be here.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You've been dead so long, but you still fantasize about letting this wicked spire descend upon Leithanien again.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You won't succeed!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I will use all my Arts, wave my wand until it breaks, manipulate my Originium dice until they shatter.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: If you still have flesh, I will destroy it. If you still have a soul, I will annihilate it.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I will interrogate you, curse you, and I will kill you.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: —Witch King!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Franz.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Do not touch the notes in the air.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: The witchcraft I've integrated into the melody here—which I have deleted—still contains a terrible power that will last until it completely dissipates.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Calm your emotions, evade the will of the ancients from a millennium ago. Do not let your mind be distracted.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Ebenholz tightens his grip on his wand, but cannot say a word.
He has read all about the Witch King. Not too long ago, he was even imprisoned in this room. He knows his history.
The notes flow slowly about the space. The melody known as 'Siracusa' is leaving the Movement that is 'Leithanien.'

He hears what sounds like the booming of loud thunder, pouring rain, and surging wind. The Will of Leithanien has turned into a power that matches heaven and earth, washing repeatedly over the small room.
Even standing at the door, the surging energy presses firmly against his heartbeat.
The man at the center of the room does not turn to look at him. He is focused and proud. He is a reef that stands above the turbulent waves.
Ebenholz cannot help but suspect he has come to the wrong place. This looks more like the fateful night of a certain composer, or a most passionate lecture by a historian.
There is no hatred here, no destiny, nowhere to place his anger.
Ebenholz suddenly realizes one thing: he has never truly seen the Witch King in all his life—
Not even in his most terrifying nightmares.
Fremont, you're late again.
I don't recall you being such a popular teacher. Did you find yourself waylaid by a crowd of students?

First, if a teacher's temperament makes you hesitate in the face of knowledge, that means nothing more than that these youths claiming to be Leithanien's finest are in fact fit only to tend the ivy that climbs her spires.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Secondly, it is Ludwigs-Universität, not you, that grants me my scholarly stipend each month. I am not at your beck and call.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Or should I not talk back to His Majesty the Great Herkunftshorn like this?
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: This isn't the first time, nor will it be the last.
attributes.name: Herkunftshorn

attributes.content: Next month, Kurfürsten from across the land will begin to arrive in Vedunien. Time is running out, Fremont.
attributes.name: Herkunftshorn

attributes.content: I hope that when their audiences conclude, they will each take copies of the amended Güldenesgesatz back to their respective Kreise.
attributes.name: Herkunftshorn

attributes.content: You're known far and wide as an exceptional monarch, even called a once-in-a-millennium ruler by these sheep and deer. Are you really so eager to set your own prestige in stone?
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: What's next? Bringing the Kurfürsten's armies and civic powers under the direct control of the imperial spire?
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: We've already discussed this.
attributes.name: Herkunftshorn

attributes.content: When I first arrived in Leithanien, the Kaiser at the time was already troubled by the Siracusan Question. How long has it been?
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Now, the wolf pups dare not make but slightly bigger moves.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: You've only just ascended. Why not take some time to choose your robes for the upcoming ceremony?
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: I've already chosen.
attributes.name: Herkunftshorn

attributes.content: Are you still worried that amending the Güldenesgesatz and the accompanying policies could plunge the realm into unforeseen turmoil?
attributes.name: Herkunftshorn

attributes.content: I don't care what happens to Leithanien, but moving my library would be a tremendous pain.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: You've been studying the Movement ever since you became Kurfürst of Einwald. We both know precisely what it is, and why no one dared consider amending it for a thousand years.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: The three main sections, the tenfold melody woven into one... It's a truly superior piece of witchcraft, created by the Arts masters of a prior millennium.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: It is The Supreme Will of Leithanien, infused with the power of countless sages into the creation, contemplation, and protection of this land.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: It is as close as we could possibly come to eternity.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Eternity?
attributes.name: Herkunftshorn

attributes.content: Setting aside the Minoan philosophers musing on the question of whether or not a man can step into the same river twice, I think only the Liches are particularly fond of using that word.
attributes.name: Herkunftshorn

attributes.content: And only you people truly understand its meaning.
attributes.name: Herkunftshorn

attributes.content: Eternity... The immutable, the immoveable. But eternity does not mean immortality.
attributes.name: Herkunftshorn

attributes.content: Indeed, the sages who crafted the Movement a thousand years ago accomplished an impossible feat.
attributes.name: Herkunftshorn

attributes.content: That is when this land came to be known as Leithanien, but it's more than just the name of a country.
attributes.name: Herkunftshorn

attributes.content: The idea of 'Leithanien' is what allows the people here to both prosper and suffer together, engraving elegance, harmony, morality, and beauty into every breath we take.
attributes.name: Herkunftshorn

attributes.content: They of a millennium ago crafted a superior vision for the country, making 'Leithanien' into a truth of the land.
attributes.name: Herkunftshorn

attributes.content: But all truths eventually decay, and our current friction with Siracusa is the greatest proof of that.
attributes.name: Herkunftshorn

attributes.content: But I will bring a better future to Leithanien.
attributes.name: Herkunftshorn

attributes.content: The new Leithanian ruler produces the Movement and looks at the Lich.
Eternity... immortality...
Herkunftshorn's voice is not heavy, but Fremont hears these hefty words shatter and reassemble between his lips and teeth.
How arrogant of you. How very 'Herkunftshorn.'
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: But how can you ensure that Leithanien, under your rule, won't face even greater crises? That the future you're bringing will be truly immortal?
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: There is no composition that can't be written, no Arts that can't be surpassed, no will that can't be overcome, no unknown that can't be conquered...
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Immortality lies in renewal.
attributes.name: Herkunftshorn

attributes.content: To this day, both the ocean and the sky remain shrouded in the fog of cognition, and this continent is the limit of what Terrans can know and perceive.
attributes.name: Herkunftshorn

attributes.content: But the knowledge you've shared tells us that even the loftiest clouds and deepest sea trenches are nothing but 'reality' imprisoned by time and space.
attributes.name: Herkunftshorn

attributes.content: And beyond this reality there exists another side of the world. A realm of emptiness, elusive and dangerous.
attributes.name: Herkunftshorn

attributes.content: If the questions are endless, then so too must be the answers.
attributes.name: Herkunftshorn

attributes.content: The Graf's spire in Urtica is too small, so I built the Genesis Spire in Vedunien. It is already the tallest in Leithanien, but not necessarily across all the lands.
attributes.name: Herkunftshorn

attributes.content: But I will never stop. That is the difference between myself and sages past.
attributes.name: Herkunftshorn

attributes.content: That is immortality, Fremont.
attributes.name: Herkunftshorn

attributes.content: I hope that when you build a new spire, you'll make a few extra rooms. So you won't need to use my own secret chamber just to modify a piece of music.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: I will.
attributes.name: Herkunftshorn

attributes.content: Now then, let us begin.
attributes.name: Herkunftshorn

attributes.content: I'll go activate all the resonance capture devices. It will all be clearer once we dismantle the melody later.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Herkunftshorn sits firmly on the chair in the center of the room, unfolding the Movement. Fremont nudges aside priceless ancient tomes to make room for the witchcraft matrices.
By the way, Fremont, what is it you call the other side of the world?
attributes.name: Herkunftshorn

attributes.content: (Sarkaz) 'The beginning and end of all threads.'
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: A petty name.
attributes.name: Herkunftshorn

attributes.content: Their phylactery grants Liches an almost unique ability among the races. Concealing that phylactery means a life that will not end.
attributes.name: Herkunftshorn

attributes.content: With infinite time, Liches are allowed to glimpse the infinite truths of the world. But do you treat them as merely pages in a tome of knowledge?
attributes.name: Herkunftshorn

attributes.content: Caution is in our nature. The more we discover, the fewer spaces we can live.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Right then, Fremont, what about you?
attributes.name: Herkunftshorn

attributes.content: Me?
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: 'The beginning and end of all threads' ...
attributes.name: Herkunftshorn

attributes.content: You often complain that the Liches under your command are either too young or too hidebound, but have you ever considered entering that space, rather than treating it as simply a drawer in which to hide your phylactery?
attributes.name: Herkunftshorn

attributes.content: A terrible chill sweeps over Fremont.
A faint but dazzling light blooms atop Herkunftshorn's scepter. He has already begun to play the Güldenesgesatz. Fremont's hands have not stopped either.
Lich and Caprinae, King of the Royal Court and Kaiser of Leithanien, they have always moved in tacit agreement.
Even in the tensest moments, the two could insert discussions on various topics. Philosophy, music, and sometimes even the climate and cuisine of Leithanien.
Herkunftshorn had raised the matter so naturally. The true secret threatening the mortality of the Liches.
If he used his Exile to its fullest extent, the lifethreads could dissolve all of these notes in an instant, annihilating the defenseless man before him.
No one else knew the Leithanian Kaiser had come here. He would have enough time to tell the Lich Court to flee the country.
But Herkunftshorn had raised it so naturally, casually bringing up the secret that had remained hidden all these long years.
Hahahaha!
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: After a long while, Fremont bursts into hearty laughter.
Wonderful. As it happens, I've also encountered some bottlenecks in my study of that space.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: If you're really interested, Herkunftshorn...
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: I could lend you my phylactery.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: That's enough, Herkunftshorn.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Don't you find the nostalgia nauseating? It's enough to make me want to vomit last night's leftovers. Besides, I'm running out of time.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: It's been a while, Fremont.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: I'm sure you remember what you've borrowed. The time has come to return it.
attributes.name: Fremont
